15#ifndef DNS_JOURNAL_H
16#define DNS_JOURNAL_H 1
17
18/*****
19 ***** Module Info
20 *****/
21
22/*! \file dns/journal.h
23 * \brief
24 * Database journaling.
25 */
26
27/***
28 *** Imports
29 ***/
30
31#include <inttypes.h>
32#include <stdbool.h>
33
34#include <isc/lang.h>
35#include <isc/magic.h>
36
37#include <dns/name.h>
38#include <dns/diff.h>
39#include <dns/rdata.h>
40#include <dns/types.h>
41
42/***
43 *** Defines.
44 ***/
45#define DNS_JOURNALOPT_RESIGN 0x00000001
46
47#define DNS_JOURNAL_READ 0x00000000 /* false */
48#define DNS_JOURNAL_CREATE 0x00000001 /* true */
49#define DNS_JOURNAL_WRITE 0x00000002
50
51#define DNS_JOURNAL_SIZE_MAX INT32_MAX
52#define DNS_JOURNAL_SIZE_MIN 4096
53
54/***
55 *** Types
56 ***/
57
58/*%
59 * A dns_journal_t represents an open journal file. This is an opaque type.
60 *
61 * A particular dns_journal_t object may be opened for writing, in which case
62 * it can be used for writing transactions to a journal file, or it can be
63 * opened for reading, in which case it can be used for reading transactions
64 * from (iterating over) a journal file. A single dns_journal_t object may
65 * not be used for both purposes.
66 */
67typedef struct dns_journal dns_journal_t;
68
69
70/***
71 *** Functions
72 ***/
73
74ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
75
76/**************************************************************************/
77
78isc_result_t
79dns_db_createsoatuple(dns_db_t *db, dns_dbversion_t *ver, isc_mem_t *mctx,
80 dns_diffop_t op, dns_difftuple_t **tp);
81/*!< brief
82 * Create a diff tuple for the current database SOA.
83 * XXX this probably belongs somewhere else.
84 */
85
86
87/*@{*/
88#define DNS_SERIAL_GT(a, b) ((int)(((a) - (b)) & 0xFFFFFFFF) > 0)
89#define DNS_SERIAL_GE(a, b) ((int)(((a) - (b)) & 0xFFFFFFFF) >= 0)
90/*!< brief
91 * Compare SOA serial numbers. DNS_SERIAL_GT(a, b) returns true iff
92 * a is "greater than" b where "greater than" is as defined in RFC1982.
93 * DNS_SERIAL_GE(a, b) returns true iff a is "greater than or equal to" b.
94 */
95/*@}*/
96
97/**************************************************************************/
98/*
99 * Journal object creation and destruction.
100 */
101
102isc_result_t
103dns_journal_open(isc_mem_t *mctx, const char *filename, unsigned int mode,
104 dns_journal_t **journalp);
105/*%<
106 * Open the journal file 'filename' and create a dns_journal_t object for it.
107 *
108 * DNS_JOURNAL_CREATE open the journal for reading and writing and create
109 * the journal if it does not exist.
110 * DNS_JOURNAL_WRITE open the journal for reading and writing.
111 * DNS_JOURNAL_READ open the journal for reading only.
112 */
113
114void
115dns_journal_destroy(dns_journal_t **journalp);
116/*%<
117 * Destroy a dns_journal_t, closing any open files and freeing its memory.
118 */
119
120/**************************************************************************/
121/*
122 * Writing transactions to journals.
123 */
124
125isc_result_t
126dns_journal_begin_transaction(dns_journal_t *j);
127/*%<
128 * Prepare to write a new transaction to the open journal file 'j'.
129 *
130 * Requires:
131 * \li 'j' is open for writing.
132 */
133
134isc_result_t
135dns_journal_writediff(dns_journal_t *j, dns_diff_t *diff);
136/*%<
137 * Write 'diff' to the current transaction of journal file 'j'.
138 *
139 * Requires:
140 * \li 'j' is open for writing and dns_journal_begin_transaction()
141 * has been called.
142 *
143 *\li 'diff' is a full or partial, correctly ordered IXFR
144 * difference sequence.
145 */
146
147isc_result_t
148dns_journal_commit(dns_journal_t *j);
149/*%<
150 * Commit the current transaction of journal file 'j'.
151 *
152 * Requires:
153 * \li 'j' is open for writing and dns_journal_begin_transaction()
154 * has been called.
155 *
156 * \li dns_journal_writediff() has been called one or more times
157 * to form a complete, correctly ordered IXFR difference
158 * sequence.
159 */
160
161isc_result_t
162dns_journal_write_transaction(dns_journal_t *j, dns_diff_t *diff);
163/*%
164 * Write a complete transaction at once to a journal file,
165 * sorting it if necessary, and commit it. Equivalent to calling
166 * dns_diff_sort(), dns_journal_begin_transaction(),
167 * dns_journal_writediff(), and dns_journal_commit().
168 *
169 * Requires:
170 *\li 'j' is open for writing.
171 *
172 * \li 'diff' contains exactly one SOA deletion, one SOA addition
173 * with a greater serial number, and possibly other changes,
174 * in arbitrary order.
175 */
176
177/**************************************************************************/
178/*
179 * Reading transactions from journals.
180 */
181
182bool
183dns_journal_empty(dns_journal_t *j);
184/*<
185 * Find out if a journal is empty.
186 */
187
188uint32_t
189dns_journal_first_serial(dns_journal_t *j);
190uint32_t
191dns_journal_last_serial(dns_journal_t *j);
192/*%<
193 * Get the first and last addressable serial number in the journal.
194 */
195
196isc_result_t
197dns_journal_iter_init(dns_journal_t *j,
198 uint32_t begin_serial, uint32_t end_serial);
199/*%<
200 * Prepare to iterate over the transactions that will bring the database
201 * from SOA serial number 'begin_serial' to 'end_serial'.
202 *
203 * Returns:
204 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
205 *\li ISC_R_RANGE begin_serial is outside the addressable range.
206 *\li ISC_R_NOTFOUND begin_serial is within the range of addressable
207 * serial numbers covered by the journal, but
208 * this particular serial number does not exist.
209 */
210
211/*@{*/
212isc_result_t
213dns_journal_first_rr(dns_journal_t *j);
214isc_result_t
215dns_journal_next_rr(dns_journal_t *j);
216/*%<
217 * Position the iterator at the first/next RR in a journal
218 * transaction sequence established using dns_journal_iter_init().
219 *
220 * Requires:
221 * \li dns_journal_iter_init() has been called.
222 *
223 */
224/*@}*/
225
226void
227dns_journal_current_rr(dns_journal_t *j, dns_name_t **name, uint32_t *ttl,
228 dns_rdata_t **rdata);
229/*%<
230 * Get the name, ttl, and rdata of the current journal RR.
231 *
232 * Requires:
233 * \li The last call to dns_journal_first_rr() or dns_journal_next_rr()
234 * returned ISC_R_SUCCESS.
235 */
236
237/**************************************************************************/
238/*
239 * Database roll-forward.
240 */
241
242isc_result_t
243dns_journal_rollforward(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_db_t *db, unsigned int options,
244 const char *filename);
245/*%<
246 * Roll forward (play back) the journal file "filename" into the
247 * database "db". This should be called when the server starts
248 * after a shutdown or crash.
249 *
250 * Requires:
251 *\li 'mctx' is a valid memory context.
252 *\li 'db' is a valid database which does not have a version
253 * open for writing.
254 *\li 'filename' is the name of the journal file belonging to 'db'.
255 *
256 * Returns:
257 *\li DNS_R_NOJOURNAL when journal does not exist.
258 *\li ISC_R_NOTFOUND when current serial in not in journal.
259 *\li ISC_R_RANGE when current serial in not in journals range.
260 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS journal has been applied successfully to database.
261 * others
262 */
263
264isc_result_t
265dns_journal_print(isc_mem_t *mctx, const char *filename, FILE *file);
266/* For debugging not general use */
267
268isc_result_t
269dns_db_diff(isc_mem_t *mctx,
270 dns_db_t *dba, dns_dbversion_t *dbvera,
271 dns_db_t *dbb, dns_dbversion_t *dbverb,
272 const char *journal_filename);
273
274isc_result_t
275dns_db_diffx(dns_diff_t *diff, dns_db_t *dba, dns_dbversion_t *dbvera,
276 dns_db_t *dbb, dns_dbversion_t *dbverb,
277 const char *journal_filename);
278/*%<
279 * Compare the databases 'dba' and 'dbb' and generate a diff/journal
280 * entry containing the changes to make 'dba' from 'dbb' (note
281 * the order). This journal entry will consist of a single,
282 * possibly very large transaction. Append the journal
283 * entry to the journal file specified by 'journal_filename' if
284 * non-NULL.
285 */
286
287isc_result_t
288dns_journal_compact(isc_mem_t *mctx, char *filename, uint32_t serial,
289 uint32_t target_size);
290/*%<
291 * Attempt to compact the journal if it is greater that 'target_size'.
292 * Changes from 'serial' onwards will be preserved. If the journal
293 * exists and is non-empty 'serial' must exist in the journal.
294 */
295
296bool
297dns_journal_get_sourceserial(dns_journal_t *j, uint32_t *sourceserial);
298void
299dns_journal_set_sourceserial(dns_journal_t *j, uint32_t sourceserial);
300/*%<
301 * Get and set source serial.
302 *
303 * Returns:
304 * true if sourceserial has previously been set.
305 */
306
307ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
308
309#endif /* DNS_JOURNAL_H */
310
